question.text: Type of flower and pollination that is observed in the given plant is

options.text:
Flower 1 is chasmogamous and undergoes self-pollination;
Flower 2 is cleistogamous and undergoes cross-pollination

Flower 1 is cleistogamous and undergoes cross-pollination;
Flower 2 is chasmogamous and undergoes self-pollination

Flower 1 is chasmogamous and undergoes self-pollination;
Flower 2 is chasmogamous and undergoes cross-pollination

Flower 1 is chasmogamous and undergoes cross-pollination;
Flower 2 is cleistogamous and undergoes self-pollination

solution.text: Cleistogamous flowers never open and in them only self-pollination is operated. In Commelina benghalensis (kankauoa), the underground flowers are cleistogamous, in which Cleistogamy (a type of self-pollination) occurs. Most of the flowers are chasmogamous and undergoes cross-pollination.
